intro: Pterichis triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three lobes and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Pterichis triloba is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
